title: Micropterix isobasella
text:
Micropterix isobasella is a species of <a href="moth">moth</a> belonging to the family <a href="Micropterigidae">Micropterigidae</a>. It has a restricted <a href="alpine%20climate">alpine</a> distribution in southern <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a> and northern <a href="Italy">Italy</a>.
This is a small moth with a <a href="forewing">forewing</a> length of up to . The forewings are gold-coloured with a greenish tinge and, unlike many of its congeners, have little or no patterning. Very little is known about the life history of this species and the <a href="larva">larva</a> and <a href="pupa">pupa</a> are unknown.
